author: @JmanBC
text: Pythin 3.11 code"  import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import matplotlib.ticker as mticker import matplotlib.dates as mdates import numpy as np from matplotlib import style  style.use("ggplot")     def graphRawFX():     date,bid,ask = np.genfromtxt('D:\Python\data\GBPUSD1d.txt', unpack=True,                               delimiter=',',                               converters={0: mdates.datestr2num})     fig=plt.figure(figsize=(10,7))      ax1 = plt.subplot2grid((40,40), (0,0), rowspan=40, colspan=40)     ax1.plot(date,bid)     ax1.plot(date,ask)     ax1.xaxis.set_major_formatter(mdates.DateFormatter('%Y-%m-%D %H:%M:%S'))     ####     plt.grid(True)     for label in ax1.xaxis.get_ticklabels():             label.set_rotation(45)     plt.gca().get_yaxis().get_major_formatter().set_useOffset(False)     #######     ax1_2 = ax1.twinx()     ax1_2.fill_between(date, 0, (ask-bid), facecolor='g',alpha=.3)      plt.subplots_adjust(bottom=.23)          plt.show()   graphRawFX()

author: @michealomojola9043
text: For those with Python3.x  def graphRawFX():     data = pd.read_csv (r'GBPUSD/GBPUSD1d.txt')     data.columns = ['date', 'bid', 'ask']     data = data.set_index('date')     data.index = pd.to_datetime(data.index, format='%Y%m%d%H%M%S')     fig, ax1 = plt.subplots()     ax1.plot(data.index, data.bid)     ax1.plot(data.index, data.ask)     ax1_2 = ax1.twinx()     ax1_2.fill_between(data.index, 0, data.bid - data.ask, facecolor = 'g', alpha = .3)     plt.subplots_adjust(bottom=.23)     plt.xticks(rotation=45)     plt.grid(True)     plt.show()

author: @veniciussoaresdasilva6614
text: Answer for the correction to recently python version 3.0 in the second video below:     date,bid,ask = np.loadtxt('GBPUSD1d.txt', unpack=True,                               delimiter=',',                               converters={0: lambda x: mdates.datestr2num(x.decode('utf8'))})

author: @mr.nonederful3314
text: 'plt.gca().get_yaxis().get_major_formatter_().set_useOffset(False)' failed on my chart, wasn't able to get it sorted.   Adding 'from matplotlib.ticker import FormatStrFormatter' and, ax1.yaxis.set_major_formatter(FormatStrFormatter('%.4f')) allowed me to set the decimal places out where I needed them. see  https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29188757/matplotlib-specify-format-of-floats-for-tick-lables/29188910 for more info.
